Class Plot

  • java.lang.Object
    • plotframes.plots.Plot
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPlot
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ShortTimeFourierPlot, SpectralDensityPlot, TestPlot, WaveformPlot, WaveletDenoisedPlot, WaveletPlot, WelchPlot

extends java.lang.Object
implements IPlot

      • readData

        protected void readData()
        Reads the raw data from the source input (eg. data file) and registers it with setRawData(double[][]). The data can then be accessed with getRawData()

      • setMetaData

        protected abstract java.lang.Object setMetaData(java.lang.Object data)
        Sets the metadata in the data object if needed. Meta datas can be anything, depending on the plot. For instance, the labels.
        Parameters:
        data -
        Returns:
        the data Object now containing the meta data

      • processSignal

        protected abstract java.lang.Object processSignal()
        Applies the needed treatments to the raw signal and return it in a data Object form, corresponding to whatever the plot component can handle.
        Note: The raw data can be accessed by getRawData()
        Returns:
        the plottable Object data

      • shiftTimeValues

        protected double[] shiftTimeValues(double[] timeArr,
                       double seconds)
        Tool method usable by time-domain plot implementations to shift the x-axis by n seconds.
        It's just a
        for each x : x = x + n
        Parameters:
        timeArr - values to shift
        seconds - number of secondes to shift. Usualy corresponds to the starting point in data
        Returns:
        shiffted values array
